title: (x) A Series of Unfortunate Events book series text face - Caslon 540 {Nicholas Gross}
content:
Although I don’t have a screen shot, I want to know what the font is that is used in the body of A Series of Unfortunate Events. Not the title or chapters font, just the body (regular) text portion. Thanks!

 [‹ (x) www.vivecuervoandroll.com.mx rugged square sans - Chinese Rocks {Nathan}](http://web.archive.org/web/20081211064735/http:/typophile.com/node/29038 "Go to previous forum topic") [NEW! Type ID Pop Quiz V2.1 - Expert Level ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081211064735/http:/typophile.com/node/27994 "Go to next forum topic")
author: fathairyape

comments.content:
fathairyape,

pardon my stupid question: screen shot, title, chapters - are you talking about a DVD or a book? Google tells me _A Series of Unfortunate Events_ is a children’s book series they made a movie from. Since you mention “body text”, I assume you mean the book(s).

Looks like an ID request for parents, booksellers or those particularly young at heart. :)

My guess is some kind of [caslon](http://web.archive.org/web/20081211064735/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&startrow=1&records=20&currpage=1&totalrecords=58&searchby=&searchID=&searchletter=&searchstr=caslon&font_categories_checkbox=font_name_search&fontRendererText=A+Series+of+Unfortunate+events) perhaps 540?

I was difficult with my crappy amazon sample, you would be able to judge better with the book in front of you; I looked at the capital T, the lowercase g, the capital O and the lowercase t mainly.

It would make sense that it’s caslon because it would match the titles which seem to be set in some version of antique caslon,  
sorry for vagueness but I hope this helps

—N

J\_P: Well I was at the bookstore and saw that the infamous new Lemony Snicket book was out. Not being in my age group, I just flipped through the pages to see if my cousins would like it and fell in love with type. I’m talking about the book, yes. :-D

— David

Any chance someone has one of these books at home and can post a scan of some text?

- Mike Yanega

Apparently our old friend Cheshire Dave did a [review of the books](http://web.archive.org/web/20081211064735/http:/www.cheshiredave.com/mastication/covers/200311/snicket.html), but seems only to have discussed the cover type (Antique Caslon). I wrote to him to see if he also ID’d the inside text, or could provide a scan.

- Mike Yanega
Looks like Caslon 540 to me. (My daughter has the whole series out from the library.)

Late again! I checked a couple of the books out of the library today, and made a scan (attached). I ran the characteristics through the [Serif Font ID Guide](http://web.archive.org/web/20081211064735/http:/bowfinprintworks.com/SerifGuide/serifsearch.php) and Caslon 540 would have been my pick too, but [Caslon Classico](http://web.archive.org/web/20081211064735/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/caslon-classico/) by Franko Luin was almost identical.

- Mike Yanega
